1.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
a knife or razor (as making bare); also a scabbard (as being bare, i.e. empty)
properly, to hammer out (an edge), i.e. to sharpen
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

3.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

4.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

5.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
to lay hold of; especially to pick up fire
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
to root, i.e. strike into the soil, or (by implication) to pluck from it
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

6.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play

7.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin

8.brief: an olive (as yielding illuminating oil), the tree, the branch or the berry
verdant; by analogy, new; figuratively, prosperous
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

9.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
